org.dblp.mmdb

Class FieldReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dblp.mmdb.FieldReader

  • public class FieldReader
extends java.lang.Object
    A convenience class for accessing the field values and attributes of a dblp Record. This class automatically manages decoding the internal space-efficient record representation into regular Strings.

    Example usage for unique fields: 

     FieldReader reader = record.getFieldReader();
 String textContent = reader.valueOf(tagName);
 String note = reader.attributesOf(tagName).get("note");
 // do stuff

    Example usage for repeating fields: 

     FieldReader reader = record.getFieldReader();
 for( Field field : reader.getFields(tagName) ) {
     String textContent = field.value();
     String note = field.attribute("note");
     // do stuff
 }
    See Also:
    Field

      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected FieldReader()
      Create a new, empty FieldReader.

 }</pre> idiom, use {@link #getFields(String[])} or {@link #fields(String[])}.
             <p>
             Instead of the <pre>
 if( indexOf(tag) >= 0) {
    ...

      idiom, use contains(String).

      Deprecated. 
      Use of tag numbers is discontinued.

      Instead of the 

       int index = fields.indexOf(tag);
 while (index > -1) {
     ...
     index = fields.indexOf(tag, index + 1);
 }
      idiom, use getFields(String[]) or fields(String[]).

      Instead of the 

       if( indexOf(tag) >= 0) {
    ...
 }
      idiom, use contains(String).

    • Constructor Detail

      • FieldReader

        protected FieldReader()
        Create a new, empty FieldReader. This constructor is intended only for extensions, and the implementing class has to take care of initializing all member fields properly.

      • getTag

        @Deprecated
public java.lang.String getTag(int i)
                                    throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Deprecated. Use Field.tag() for same result. Instead of 
         for( int i=0; i < getNumberOfFields(); i++ ) {
     if getTag(i).equals(tag) {
        ...
     }
 }
        idiom, use getFields(String[]) or fields(String[]).
        Retrieves the tag name of the i-th field of the given record.
        Parameters:
        i - The field index.
        Returns:
        The tag name string
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if i < 0 || i >= getNumberOfFields().

      • hasAttribute

        @Deprecated
public boolean hasAttribute(int i)
        Deprecated. Use Field.attribute(String) for same result.
        Checks whether the i-th field of the given record has any attributes.
        Parameters:
        i - The field index.
        Returns:
        true if the i-th field has any attribute, otherwise false . If i < 0 || i >= getNumberOfFields() then this method will always return false.

        Retrieves the attributes of the i-th field of the given record as key-value map.
        Parameters:
        i - The field index.
        Returns:
        The attributes as key-value map entry.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if i < 0 || i >= getNumberOfFields().

      • getValue

        @Deprecated
public java.lang.String getValue(int i)
                                      throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Deprecated. Use Field.value() for the same result.

        Instead of the 

         for( int i=0; i < getNumberOfFields(); i++ ) {
     if getTag(i).equals(tag) {
        ...
     }
 }
        idiom, use getFields(String[]) or fields(String[]).
        Retrieves the field value of the i-th field of the given record. That is, the entity-encoded text content plus any (possibly nested) formatting elements like <i>, <tt>, <sub>, or <sup>.
        Parameters:
        i - The field index.
        Returns:
        The field value string.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if i < 0 || i >= getNumberOfFields().

      • indexOf

        @Deprecated
public int indexOf(java.lang.String tag)
        Deprecated. Use of tag numbers is discontinued.

        Instead of the 

         for( int i=0; i < getNumberOfFields(); i++ ) {
     if getTag(i).equals(tag) {
        ...
     }
 }</pre> idiom, use {@link #getFields(String[])} or {@link #fields(String[])}.
             <p>
             Instead of the <pre>
 if( indexOf(tag) >= 0) {
    ...
 }
        idiom, use contains(String).
        Retrieves the index of the first occurrence of the field tag in the given record.
        Parameters:
        tag - The tag.
        Returns:
        The index of the first occurrence, or -1 if there is no such field.

      • indexOf

        @Deprecated
public int indexOf(java.lang.String tag,
                               int fromIndex)
        Deprecated. Use of tag numbers is discontinued.

        Instead of the 

         int index = fields.indexOf(tag);
 while (index > -1) {
     ...
     index = fields.indexOf(tag, index + 1);
 }
        idiom, use getFields(String[]) or fields(String[]).

        Instead of the 

         if( indexOf(tag) >= 0) {
    ...
 }
        idiom, use contains(String).
        Retrieves the index of the first occurrence of the field tag in the given record, starting at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        tag - The tag.
        fromIndex - The index from which to start the search.
        Returns:
        The index of the first occurrence, starting at the specified index, or -1 if there is no such field. If fromIndex < 0 || fromIndex >= getNumberOfFields() then this method always returns -1.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.String tag)
        Checks whether the given record contains a field of the given tag name.
        Parameters:
        tag - The field tag.
        Returns:
        true if such a field exists in the record, otherwise false.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.String tag,
                        java.lang.String value)
        Checks whether the given record contains the queried field tag and value pair.
        Parameters:
        tag - The field tag.
        value - The field value. That is, the entity-encoded text content plus any (possibly nested) formatting elements like <i>, <tt>, <sub>, or <sup>.
        Returns:
        true if such a pair exists in the record, otherwise false.

      • valueOf

        public java.lang.String valueOf(java.lang.String tag)
        Retrieves the field value of the first occurrence of the field tag in the given record. That is, the entity-encoded text content plus any (possibly nested) formatting elements like <i>, <tt>, <sub>, or <sup>.
        Parameters:
        tag - The tag.
        Returns:
        The field value string, or null if no such field exists.

      • getAttributesOf

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getAttributesOf(java.lang.String tag)
        Retrieves the attributes of the first occurrence of the field tag in the given record as key-value map.
        Parameters:
        tag - The tag.
        Returns:
        The attributes as key-value map entry, or null if no such field exists.

      • attributesOf

        public java.util.stream.Stream<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> attributesOf(java.lang.String tag)
        Retrieves a sequential stream of the attributes of the first occurrence of the field tag in the given record. Elements of this stream are the key-value map entries.
        Parameters:
        tag - The tag.
        Returns:
        The attributes as key-value map entry, or null if no such field exists.

        Returns:
        The matching fields.
